snippet: The two 16-year-old victims of Asiana Flight 214 were among 34 10th-grade Chinese students and chaperones who were bound for a summer camp outside Los Angeles.
abstract: Ye Mengyuan and Wang Linjia, two 16-year-old victims of Asiana Flight 214, which crashed at San Francisco International Airport, were among 34 10th-grade Chinese students and chaperones who were bound for a summer camp outside Los Angeles.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by David Barboza, Jens Erik Gould, Richard Pérez-Peña, Kyle Spencer and Mei-Yu Liu.

lead_paragraph: The two 16-year-old victims of Asiana Flight 214 were among 34 10th-grade Chinese students and chaperones who were bound for a summer camp outside Los Angeles.

headline.main: For Chinese Families, a Journey Cut Short, and With It Their Dreams
headline.print_headline: For Chinese Families, a Journey Cut Short, and With It Their Dreams
